law.catch_line: Aggravated trafficking in controlled substance in first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of aggravated trafficking in a controlled substance in the first degree when he or she knowingly and unlawfully traffics in one hundred (100) grams or more of heroin.

Aggravated trafficking in a controlled substance in the first degree is a Class B felony, and the defendant shall not be released on probation, shock probation, conditional discharge, or parole until he or she has served at least fifty percent (50%) of the sentence imposed.

law.history: Created 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 66, sec. 15, effective March 25, 2015.
